data.text:
R Nagarathna, MD, FRCP, DSc

Professor, VaYU

Email: nxr@vayuusa.org

Dr. R Nagarathna is the Medical Director of Arogyadhama, the Holistic Health Care Center at Prashanti Kuteeram, Bengaluru. Having mastered Yoga, she combines the best of the east (Ancient Indian Traditional System – Yoga) with best of the west (Modern Medicine System – Allopathy) for treating even acute cases of non-communicable diseases such as Asthma, Heart disease, Cancer. Apart from being Medical Director, as an Academician, she has been guiding many PhD Students of S-VYASA.

Specialties: Yoga & Meditation

Memberships

Fellow of Royal College of Physicians, Edinburgh.

Member of Royal College of Physicians, Edinburgh.

Fellow of International College of Angiology.

Life Member of Association of Physicians of India.

Member of Third World Organization for Women in Science, C/o Third World

Academy of Sciences, Trieste, Italy.

Experience

Medical Director at Arogyadhama and Faculty, S-VYASA, Bengaluru.

Assistant Surgeon, Children’s Unit, Vani Vilas Hospital, Bengaluru.

Assistant Surgeon cum Lecturer, CG Hospital & JJM Medical College, Davanagere, Karnataka.

Senior House Officer, Poole Hospital, Department of Geriatric Medicine Middleborough General Hospital, Cleveland, UK.

Registrar, Rheumatology, West Lane Hospital Middleborough,Cleveland, UK.

Chief Medical Officer, Vivekananda Kendra Yoga Chikitsa Nilayam, Kanyakumari, India.

Visiting Consultant Physician, Ashwini Hospital, Madikeri, Coorg, Karnataka, India.

Awards

Vishweshwaraiah Vijnana Puraskara (2008) for the contribution in the field of Scientific Research in the field Yoga by Swadeshi Vijnana Andholana, Karnataka.

The Essel Karnataka’s Best Medical Service Award (2007) by ZEE-Kannada Television Channel Awards.

Vidya Varenya (2005) for the contributions in the field of Yoga by Ministry of Health, Vyaps Techno Soft Pvt. Ltd. and Quaser Innovation Pvt. Ltd., Bengaluru.

Woman of Excellence award (2003) by Badaganadu Sangha Association, Bengaluru, for the Service to Humanity through Yoga Therapy.

Dr. P S Shankar Vaidya Shree award (2001) by Dr. P S Shankar Pratistana, Gulbarga.

Patanjali Award (2000) for the contributions in the field of Yoga by Indian Systems of Medicine and Homoeopathy (ISM & H), Ministry of Health and Family Welfare, Government of India, Bengaluru.

Karnataka Kalpavalli award (1995) for the Service to Women through Yoga by Shaswathi, a Women’s Organization, NMKRV College, Bengaluru.

Doctor’s Day award (1992) by IMA, Bengaluru Branch.

Honorary Doctor of Science (DSc) (2012) from Kuvempu University, Shimoga, Karnataka.

Distinctions
